title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people; respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences; Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback; Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience; Focusing best just us individuals, overall community. Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind; Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment; Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission; conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Golem User. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

Return RStudio enter: console. opens new window RStudio. window opens, write: GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN token (string letters numbers) just copied GitHub. Step 3: Save file, close , restart R. , able install movedesign usual command:

title: movedesign
text: movedesign built using R language Shiny easy--use user interface (GUI). application allow test different tracking regimes considering initially set research question (currently home range speed/distance estimation). Doesn’t require R coding experience. Leverages ctmm R package statistically unbiased methods.

title: movedesign
text: ctmm R package ctmmweb Shiny application.

title: ‘movedesign’ tutorial
text: application includes built-guided tutorial help navigate features. open 'Home' tab, ’ll find following:  step--step guide walk app, ensuring understand features functionality. action required, clearly highlighted. Please follow instructions carefully, step builds previous one. action needed, simply continue next step clicking 'Next' pressing right arrow key keyboard. Warning: Avoid interacting anything outside highlighted zones tutorial, may disrupt guided experience. tutorial provides overview key features cover detailed definitions. -depth explanations, can access comprehensive  help tips time. Documentation also available (Silva et al. 2023).  current options movedesign workflows. Users may configure study design selecting different options data source, research target, analytical target. 1.1. Data Source Users can specify want obtain data: Upload: Import dataset local file. Select: Choose pre-existing datasets available application. Simulate: Generate synthetic data testing modeling purposes. 1.2. Research Target Users can define primary research focus: Home range: Analyze long-term space-use requirements. Speed & distance: Investigate movement metrics speed distance traveled. 1.3. Analytical Target Users can decide type statistical analysis: Individual estimate: Obtain metrics single individual. Mean estimate sampled population: Obtain mean estimate across sampled group. Compare estimates two sampled populations: Perform comparative analysis two groups. Additionally, users option : Add individual variation: Include variation among individuals simulation. workflows follows stepwise approach, tabs presented sequence. Workflow based (Silva et al. 2023).  guided real animal tracking project available package. simulate data scratch, exit tour (click × button tutorial box) navigate 'Simulate data' tab, another guided tour available. First, navigate (1) 'Select data' tab load dataset available within package. , move (2) 'Sampling design' tab define sampling duration interval. Finally, proceed (3) 'Analyses' tab.

title: ‘movedesign’ tutorial
text: current options movedesign workflows. Users may configure study design selecting different options data source, research target, analytical target. 1.1. Data Source Users can specify want obtain data: Upload: Import dataset local file. Select: Choose pre-existing datasets available application. Simulate: Generate synthetic data testing modeling purposes. 1.2. Research Target Users can define primary research focus: Home range: Analyze long-term space-use requirements. Speed & distance: Investigate movement metrics speed distance traveled. 1.3. Analytical Target Users can decide type statistical analysis: Individual estimate: Obtain metrics single individual. Mean estimate sampled population: Obtain mean estimate across sampled group. Compare estimates two sampled populations: Perform comparative analysis two groups. Additionally, users option : Add individual variation: Include variation among individuals simulation. workflows follows stepwise approach, tabs presented sequence.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Inês Silva. Maintainer, author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Silva, ., Fleming, C. H., Noonan, M. J., Fagan, W. F., & Calabrese, J. M. (2023). movedesign: Shiny R app evaluate sampling design animal movement studies. Methods Ecology Evolution, 14(9), 2216-2225.
code: @Article{,   doi = {10.1111/2041-210X.14153},   year = {2023},   author = {Ines Silva and Christen H. Fleming and Michael J. Noonan and William F. Fagan and Justin M. Calabrese},   title = {movedesign: Shiny R app to evaluate sampling design for animal tracking movement studies},   journal = {Methods in Ecology and Evolution}, }

title: movedesign
text: movedesign R package Shiny application designed support researchers planning evaluation movement ecology studies, focusing two key targets: estimating home range areas, estimating movement speed distance traveled. Movement ecology studies frequently make use data collected animal tracking projects. Planning successful animal tracking project requires careful consideration clear objectives. crucial plan ahead understand much data required accurately answer chosen research questions, choose optimal tracking regime schedule. assist study design, movedesign integrates continuous-time methods available ctmm R package. Animal movement inherently autocorrelated (locations similar function space time) ctmm package allows us model data continuous-time stochastic processes, dealing known biases (small sample sizes, irregular missing data, location error). app built using golem framework.

what: Fix rates of animal tracking devices. — fixrates
title: Fix rates of animal tracking devices. — fixrates
text: Dataset list fix rates typically available animal tracking devices.

title: Fix rates of animal tracking devices. — fixrates
Fix rates of animal tracking devices. — fixrates
text: object class "data.frame", 40 rows seven variables: dti_notes, dti, highlight, frq, frq_hrs. dti_notes Sampling interval text (e.g., "1 fix every month") dti Sampling interval seconds frq Sampling frequency seconds frq_hrs Sampling frequency hours highlighted Highlight group commonly-used GPS fix rates

what: movedesign: Study design of movement ecology studies — movedesign-package
title: movedesign: Study design of movement ecology studies — movedesign-package
text: `movedesign` package contains R shiny application can used assist researchers designing movement ecology studies.

title: movedesign: Study design of movement ecology studies — movedesign-package
text: Maintainer: Inês Silva .simoes-silva@hzdr.de (ORCID)

title: Table of movement processes. — movmods
text: Table listing current movement processes used within ctmm R package.

title: Table of movement processes. — movmods
text: object class "data.frame", five rows six variables: name, name_short, tau_p, tau_v, hrange, pars.

title: Table of movement processes. — movmods
text: Calabrese et al. (2016). Methods Ecology Evolution, 7(9), 1124-1132. (MEE) name Movement process names (e.g., "Ind. Ident. Distr. (IID)") name_short Abbreviated movement process names tau_p Boolean denoting whether movement process includes position autocorrelation tau_v Boolean denoting whether movement process includes velocity autocorrelation hrange Boolean denoting whether movement process includes range residency pars Character variable, display autocorrelation parameters HTML

what: Run movedesign' R Shiny Application — run_app
title: Run movedesign' R Shiny Application — run_app
text: Run movedesign' R Shiny Application

title: Run movedesign' R Shiny Application — run_app
code: run_app(   onStart = NULL,   options = list(),   enableBookmarking = NULL,   uiPattern = "/",   ... )

title: Run movedesign' R Shiny Application — run_app
text: onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. ... arguments pass golem_opts. See `?golem::get_golem_options` details.

title: Running \(\chi^2\)-IG hierarchical model meta-analyses — run_meta
text: function wraps around `run_meta_permutations` function run meta-analyses (permutations) quick evaluation.

title: Running \(\chi^2\)-IG hierarchical model meta-analyses — run_meta
code: run_meta(rv, set_target = c("hr", "ctsd"), subpop = FALSE, trace = FALSE)

title: Running \(\chi^2\)-IG hierarchical model meta-analyses — run_meta
text: rv list containing outputs, settings data objects. Must NULL. set_target Character. Research target: `"hr"` home range `"ctsd"` speed & distance. subpop Logical. TRUE, run meta-analyses groups. Default FALSE. trace Logical. TRUE, prints progress messages. Default FALSE.

title: Running \(\chi^2\)-IG hierarchical model meta-analyses — run_meta
text: outputs `run_meta_permutations` function single permutation.

what: Running \(\chi^2\)-IG hierarchical model meta-analyses (with permutations) — run_meta_permutations
title: Running \(\chi^2\)-IG hierarchical model meta-analyses (with permutations) — run_meta_permutations
text: function performs meta-analysis movement tracking data, mean home range area (AKDE) continuous-time speed distance (CTSD) estimates sampled population. leverages `ctmm` R package, specifically `meta()` function, obtain population-level mean parameters. function helps evaluate significance results permutation testing.

title: Running \(\chi^2\)-IG hierarchical model meta-analyses (with permutations) — run_meta_permutations
code: run_meta_permutations(   rv,   set_target = c("hr", "ctsd"),   subpop = FALSE,   random = FALSE,   max_samples = 100,   trace = FALSE,   .lists = NULL )

title: Running \(\chi^2\)-IG hierarchical model meta-analyses (with permutations) — run_meta_permutations
text: rv list containing outputs, settings data objects. Must NULL. set_target Character. Research target: `"hr"` home range `"ctsd"` speed & distance. subpop Logical. TRUE, run meta-analyses groups. Default FALSE. random Logical. TRUE, samples random subsets individuals. Default FALSE. max_samples Integer. Maximum number resamples `random = TRUE`. Must positive. Default 100. trace Logical. TRUE, prints progress messages. Default FALSE. .lists list containing already created meta inputs. Default NULL.

title: Running \(\chi^2\)-IG hierarchical model meta-analyses (with permutations) — run_meta_permutations
text: data frame containing meta-analysis outputs, including estimates, errors, confidence intervals, group information.

title: movedesign 0.3.0
text: Third release movedesign.

title: movedesign 0.3.0
text: Now fully supports multiple simulations within workflow. Added meta-analyses tab. Users can get mean estimates compare estimates two different groups (e.g. females/males). Users can test specific number tags, get minimum number tags specific output. Users can propagate estimate uncertainty initial dataset simulated dataset.

title: movedesign 0.3.0
text: Added outlier plots Data tabs. Added warning messages case low effective sample sizes. Report tab also highlights outputs meta-analyses.

title: movedesign 0.3.0
text: Fixed issue data upload due missing argument (https://github.com/ecoisilva/movedesign/issues/3). Fixed Report tab bug, now display correct CIs (https://github.com/ecoisilva/movedesign/issues/3). Fixed bug sampling duration/interval display correctly (https://github.com/ecoisilva/movedesign/issues/5)

title: movedesign 0.2.0
text: Second release movedesign.

title: movedesign 0.2.0
text: Began support multiple simulations within workflow. Expected errors update show mean (CIs applicable) multiple simulations. Can switch plots simulation (HR trajectories).

title: movedesign 0.2.0
text: Updated tutorial. Updated installation vignette documentation.

title: movedesign 0.2.0
text: Fixed tables blocks multiple simulations. Added internal validation steps stop invalid sampling parameters crashing app.

title: movedesign 0.1.1
text: Home range plots now also show true 95% area. Added citation("movedesign").

title: movedesign 0.1.1
text: Added blocks module. Uploading/selecting data optimized. Added alert error messages needed.

title: movedesign 0.1.1
text: Uploading incorrectly labeled files longer crashes app. Fixed bug table outputs due version 0.4.4 reactable. Main guided tour correctly follow new changes. fix_unit() now deal properly speed units. extract_pars() now works current movement models. guess_time() adjusted short runs. simulate_gps() now run properly dur_unit changed, dur set higher values.

title: movedesign 0.1.0
text: Initial release movedesign.

title: movedesign 0.1.0
text: Guided tours now cover modules. Report now covers scenario questions requested. function guess_time() now works ctmm::speed() well.

title: movedesign 0.1.0
text: Changed log-scaling plot within device tab scale_x_log10(). Tests added abbrv_unit() fix_unit(). Tests added shinytest2 framework.

title: movedesign 0.1.0
text: simulate_gps() now works properly within defined limits. Fixed bug extreme timescale parameters sims tab. Fixed bug table outputs sims tab.

title: movedesign 0.0.9
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
